metadata.title: TETRAHEDRALAND OCTAHEDRAL RESONANCE FUSION UNDER TRANSIENT CONDENSATION OFDEUTERONS AT LATTICE FOCALPOINTS

affiliation: Department of Nuclear Engineering, Osaka University, Yamadaoka 2-1, Suita, Osaka, 565-0871 Jaqpan

abstract.text: To attenpt to explain the very strange claim of observation by Mitsubishi group on the mass-and- charge t-ransfermed (increased) trausmutation (Mo-96 or P-141) out of sample zone f Sr-8 or C8-13 in the -difusin ype experiment with multi-layered Pd plate, cur muli-body deuteron fsion mndel in transient lattice focal points has been extended to hyposhesize the ocunence of 4D tetahedral and SD octahedral esonance fusion. High energy Be-8 particles by SD fusion can induce selectively capture proess to fom mass-8-and-charge-d-increased tansmutation cout of Sr-88 cr Cs-133 near PdDx kattice.

body_text.text: Recerily, the CF research group of Misnbishi Co. as repoted 12 a very strange obsevaion that the nass-8-and-charge-(atomic numbery-increased transmutation (Mo-96 or Pr-141), fiom 2 nm thin sample layer of Sr-88 or Cs-133 pasted on a multi-layened PulCaOvPd plate under the diffusion peooess of deuterium, took place selectively with significant quantity (several tens percent) rapidly in a week, without hand radiation of gamma rays and neurons. This is a big challenge to theoretical modeling. Iwamura et al of Misubishi has proposed a model of 4 di-neutrons capture process and successive 4 stages of beta-dacay to get to Mo-96 fiom Se-88 for Pr-141 fiom C3-133) . Unfotunately, the existence of stable isotope (e-g., 7r-96) on the way in the beta-decay chain from Sr-96* tctally blocks to get to Mlo-96, even if we hypothesize very hard ease of di-nsuiron emissicn.

An 8D fusion emits two high energy (47.6 MeV) Be-S purticles which owercome with 20-30 MeV high Coulomb barnier to make capture (fusion) reaction with neighboring Sr-88 ox C3-133 nuclei and will produce transmuted nuclei with mass-8-and-charge-d-increased transfer. To draw a reasonable story, we need several steps of modeling of transient D-chster foxmation, super-screening of Ccukomb repulsive force by the hypothesized transient (shoet time in 1-10 ps) bhawwicuniorn of d-shell electrons of Pd atoms, and resonant enhancement of 4D and 8D simultaneous fusion, which should occur selectively amoing the competing process of 2D, 3D, 4D, 5D, 6D, 7D, 8D, etc. chastering proes, as we explain in te following

In our previcus modei $.$ of 3D and dD fusion around danic foeal pains, transient clustering of two (2D), tree (3D) and four (4D) deuterons was considered to make competing process. The possibility of anomalous enhancement of 4D and 3D fusion compared to 2D fusion was reasoned by two effecets: 1) the excluding rule between 2D, 3D and 4D clusteing prcbabilies in the atmic motion level and 2) the resonant increase of 3D and 4D fusion cnoss sections

(effective S-alues) in the strong nuclear interaction level . Especially, 4D fusion rate could become very large as 100 W/ee (10' fsee) power kevel to meet the condition of experimental claims on counsistent amount of He-4 production in comelation with excess heat without neutrons, if the equilaterally tetrahedal condensation in short time (less than I ns) of 4 deuterons foemed at focal poins: We call this tetahedral esonance fusion (TRF). The tetrahedral configuration in PuDx latice is illustrated in Fig.l.

The nalti-body fiusin mede is still hyohetical, especially ue to the assumpion of super sreening of Coulomb barer by d-shell electons in dymamic motion. Siong coupling between lattice phoeus and electrons was assumed as is the case of high-Te superconduxtivity, which may be explained by the fomabion of quasi-partcles of electrons like Cooper pairs in shant time inerval (few ps) in particular direction of hole doped copper oxides. A. Lanzara et all has reportead the obscrvation of such quasi-particles by the angle-resolved photon emission spectoscopy analysis". The transient quasi-particle of elections can behave as more negaively charged heavy mass election which can play drastic sreeningeffiet on Coulonmb bamier between clustered deutros, and possibly open the window of cold fusion*. In usual sense, the fermion nature (Pauli's exclusion peinciple) of elecoons blocks the way to drasbc sreening efiect on low enengy d-d fusion in metal: The screning effect by electron Thomas-Fermi gas is not sufficient enough to see visible fiusion rsaes'. The phenomena of high-TC super-conductivity however suggest the existence of trarsient quasi-particle of electrons, which the authoe calls here as Inusiew beeruzanun ey ececvons. The author conceives that the liberaion from the Pauli nule, only in shat tine, for transient electon paiting under strong coupling of lattioe phonon vibeation is the key to the CF effect.
